intro: Brachyglottis laxifolia, commonly known as the slender hairless daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, white, daisy-like flowers and narrow, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal environments and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Brachyglottis laxifolia is often found in open habitats and is known for its resilience to coastal conditions.
